definition: to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: There are relationships between the gumming property of sericin and the gelation.
sentences.chinese: 丝胶的胶着性与胶凝有密切的关系。

sentences.english: Lastly, learners are in the state of persistent tiredness.
sentences.chinese: 持续产生疲劳，或处于“认知胶着”状态。

sentences.english: He walked slowly towards her and they held each other’s gaze.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢地向她走近，两人的目光胶着了。

sentences.english: The race is close and increasingly nasty.
sentences.chinese: 选情不但胶着，并且越来越恶劣。

sentences.english: The cocoon shell, hard, like a bird eggs, in the branches on the trunk or stalemate.
sentences.chinese: 茧壳坚硬，状如雀卵，胶着于树枝或树干上。

sentences.english: His goods economy thought is correct the ankylosis with the mistake.
sentences.chinese: 他的商品经济思想是正确与错误的胶着。

definition: to become caught up in an irresolvable situation (idiom)
hard to untie, hard to separate (idiom); inextricably involved/locked in battle
locked in a stalemate/to confront one another
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
a two-man saw/fig. to-and-fro between two sides
to counterattack/to come back after a defeat/to retrieve lost ground
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
